properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 11 at 4:34AM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Updated timing.

* WHAT...Southwest to west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 55
mph expected. Localized gusts to 70 mph around canyon openings.
Sierra crest ridges including Mammoth Mountain summit gusting
over 100 mph.

* WHERE...Mono County. Highest risk for wind impacts is along
and west of Highway 395 including Antelope Valley, Bridgeport,
Lee Vining, and near the Mammoth Airport.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. Peak winds through 10 AM
this morning.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will blow around unsecured objects and
create hazardous conditions for high profile vehicles in the
Eastern Sierra. This includes Highway 395. Tree limbs could be
blown down and a few power outages may result. Severe turbulence
can also be expected.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio
furniture, holiday decorations (if you really still have those
up), and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these
items away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by
making sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights
with spare batteries and/or candles in the event of a power
outage.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
